name: An Everyday Tale of a Seeker of Gold
overview: An Everyday Tale of a Seeker of Gold is a 2019 conversion of a 1986 ZX Spectrum text adventure of the same name. It was coded by John Wilson, who developed the original Spectrum version as well. The game itself is a parody of The 1982 adventure "The Hobbit", which of course is based on Tolkien's classic fantasy adventure novel of the same name. The game is part of what is known as "The Balrogian Trilogy".
